comment.author: 64752530@N00
comment._content: I love it, it's like a dreamy image of something that never existed: this picture depicts a very old Paris, from the Middle-Age or so, but it's only the representation of this past, an interpretation. And we see it in this tinted black and white photograph, more than a century old... Weird feeling, but it makes that picture a fav for me, too bad I don't know the name of the photographer! EDIT @ : thanks, I'll check that out. William Henry Goodyear is the oldest photographer I have faved yet on Flickr!

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Hi Theo, thanks for the comment - the name of the photographer is William Henry Goodyear and he was one of our first curators here at the museum.  Clicking the link in the descrip will take you to more info about him.

comment.author: 40367809@N02
comment._content: Wow.... thanks for sharing.... On the one hand you think, I've never seen something (beautiful) like that in Paris and it looks like a painting... but it's really real.... stunning somehow =) -- Seen in your Paris Exposition of 1900 set. ( ?² )
